intro: Oenothera hookeri subsp. venusta, commonly known as the showy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow to orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The showy evening primrose is known for its nocturnal pollination, attracting moths and other night-active insects.
